featured.text: At the close of the 15th century, Europeans’ craze for spices gave rise to the Spice Route, a network of sea lanes joining Europe with the Far East, where most spices came from.
During the Age of Exploration, commerce in Zanzibar quickly boomed, largely due to the rise of the spice trade.
(H) Alexander Well, they taste good if you add plenty of spices and sauces.
You will also learn important information about __(24)__ for fresh and inexpensive foods, the use of herbs and spices, and the proper ways of storing different kinds of food.

other.text: In 1499, he arrived at Zanzibar, an archipelago sitting at the crossroads of the Spice Route.
Besides spices, Zanzibar is well known for a great variety of jewelry.
Hundreds of ships sailing the Spice Route docked here, bringing spices and goods for transaction, and Zanzibar became one of the biggest trading centers in the world.

definition.zh_def: 香料；調味品，通常用於增強食物的風味。
definition.en_def: A substance used to flavor food, often derived from plants.
definition.example: She added a pinch of spice to the soup to enhance its flavor.
